contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=August 2008}} '''Johann Rudolf Wyss''' {{IPA-de|ˈjoːhan ˈruːdɔlf ˈviːs}} (March 4, 1782 - March 21, 1830) was a [[Swiss]] [[author]], [[writer]], and folklorist who wrote the words to the former [[Swiss Psalm|Swiss national anthem]] ''[[Rufst Du, mein Vaterland]]'' in 1811, and also edited the novel ''[[The Swiss Family Robinson]]'', written by his father [[Johann David Wyss]] in 1814. His father died in 1818, and Johann Rudolf Wyss died in 1830, at the young age of 48. ==Biography== Wyss (pronounced Veese) was born in [[Bern]], [[Switzerland]], and studied theology in [[Georg-August University of Göttingen|Göttingen]] and [[Martin Luther University of Halle-Wittenberg|Halle]]. In 1805 he became Professor of Philosophy at Bern's academy, and later chief librarian of its city library. He died in Bern. ==Works== * ''Vorlesungen über das höchste Gut'' (“Lectures on the highest good,” 2 vols., Tübingen, 1811) * ''Idyllen, Volkssagen, Legend und Erzählungen aus der Schweiz'' (“Idylls, folk tales, legends, and stories from Switzerland,” 3 vols., 1815-22; partly translated into French in Mme. de Montolieu's ''Châteaux suisses'', 1816) * ''Reise im Berner Oberland'' (“Travels in the Bern highlands,” 1808; French translation, ''Voyage dans l'Oberland bernois'', 2 vols., Bern, 1817) ==References== * {{Cite Americana|Wyss, Johann Rudolf}} * {{Cite AmCyc|Wyss, Johann Rudolf}} ==External links== * [http://www3.unil.ch/viatimages/index.php?module=search&projet=viaticalpes#/ouvrage-139 Pictures and texts of ''Voyage dans l'Oberland bernois'' by Johann Rudolf Wyss can be found in the database VIATIMAGES]. {{Authority control|VIAF=103654897}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Wyss, Johann Rudolf | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Swiss writer | DATE OF BIRTH = March 4, 1782 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Bern]], [[Switzerland]] | DATE OF DEATH = March 21, 1830 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Bern]], [[Switzerland]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wyss, Johann Rudolf}} [[Category:1782 births]] [[Category:1830 deaths]] [[Category:People from Bern]] [[Category:Swiss philosophers]] [[Category:Swiss writers]] {{Switzerland-writer-stub}}
